This sentence is different from what will be interpreted as the first sentence

"__AJDECLID:442:__

sentence, then
use -breakiterator from that point forward, which will output this new 
sentence.

The output from this run shows another bug in ajdoc: it should handle quoted 
strings in javadoc comments
This is the cause of the spurious error message when ajdocing the Transaction 
interface. E.g.,
"__AJDECLID:442:__
 Mark that the transaction is "poisoned." I.e., it will have to rollback."
This sentence is different from what will be interpreted as the first sentence 
in the
next major release (when that interpretation will be internationalized), which 
is:


Here is the source with a quote in a javadoc comment...

/*
 * Created on Oct 14, 2003
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2003 New Aspects of Security. All Rights Reserved.
 */
package org.atrack.persistence.api;

/**
 * 
 * Interface for ACID transactions that update resources (databases,
 * message queues, transactional file systems, etc.).
 * 
 * aTrack currently uses Hibernate to wrapper JDBC transactions, but this
 *   
 * A transaction instance must have exactly one of commit or rollback
 * called on it exactly once for correct usage. This is handled by the
 * TransactionControl aspect - clients should never call these methods.
 * 
 * @author Ron Bodkin
 *
 */
public interface Transaction {
    /**
	 * 
     * Commit the changes for this transaction (i.e., persist them).
     * May throw an exception if deadlock is detected.
     * 
	 */
	public void commit();
    
    /**
	 * Rollback the changes for this transaction (i.e., abort them). 
	 */
	public void rollback();
    
    
    /**
     * Mark that the transaction is "poisoned." I.e., it will have to rollback.
     * If commit() is called, the transaction will roll back instead.
     * This provides an alternative way of forcing rollback to exiting a
     * transaction control context via an exception.
     *
     */
    public void setRollbackOnly();

    /**
     * 
     * @return whether the transaction will rollback at completion (commit)
     * time.
     */
    public boolean isRollbackOnly();    
}
Fixed.
Ron: about that quoting report--it looks like that's standard javadoc 
behavior.  Javadoc doesn't like to see the first "." in a quote, because 
that's where it grabs the summary sentence from.  So just take the period and 
put it outside of the "." as with standard English grammar:

    /**
     * Mark that the transaction is "poisoned".
